bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Surgeon General's Office Record Card for Walter Reed, 1899

div1.p: Krassin inquires about the reported death of Reed in Cuba. A request is made for Reed to serve as a member of a board. A note dated July 17, 1900 states that Reed forwarded an efficiency report. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card for Walter Reed, 1899
div1.p:
Frank Krassin Mt Vernon
Mobile Co Ala. June 16" 99
inquires regarding the
reported death in Cuba
of Maj. Walter Reed.
End. on other side. Ho.

July 23, '99. To the A.G. of the
Army, Sir: I have the honor to re-
quest the detail of Major Walter
Reed, Surg. U.S.A., now on duty at
the Army Med. Mus. Bldg., this city,
as member of the board constituted
by par. 27, S.O. 212, A.G.O., Sept. 8,
1898, instead of Capt. Wm. C. Borden,
Asst. Surg. U.S.A., now on leave of
absence.

reported death in Cuba
of Maj. Walter Reed
End. on other Side. H.

July 23, '99. To the A.G. of the
Army Sir. I have the honor to re-
quest the detail of Major Walter
Reed, Surg. U.S.A., now on duty at
the Army Med. Mus. Bldg., this city,
as member of the board constituted
by par. 27, S.O. 212, A.G.O., Sept 8
1898, instead of Capt. Wm. C. Borden,
Asst. Surg. U.S.A., now on leave of
absence.

6. July 17 - 1900 -.
Walter Reed, Maj. & Surg.
Camp Columbia Cuba, June
30 - 1900. Forwards efficiency
report.
